meanings.def: a person who operates the controls of an aircraft, especially as a job
examples: The accident was caused by pilot error.
The pilot bailed out as the aircraft crashed into the ocean.
He has his own plane and a pilot's licence.

meanings.def: a person with special knowledge of a difficult area of water, for example, the entrance to a harbour, whose job is to guide ships through it
a single television programme that is made in order to find out whether people will like it and want to watch further programmes
a small flame that burns all the time, for example on a gas boiler, and lights a larger flame when the gas is turned on
to fly an aircraft or guide a ship; to act as a pilot
examples: The plane was piloted by the instructor.
The captain piloted the boat into a mooring.

meanings.def: to guide somebody/something somewhere, especially through a complicated place or system
examples: She piloted a bill on the rights of part-time workers through parliament.

meanings.def: to test a new product, idea, etc. with a few people or in a small area before it is introduced everywhere
examples: Several centres have been asked to pilot the new qualification.
The recycling boxes have been successfully piloted in a number of areas.
The scheme is already being piloted in Germany.

meanings.def: done on a small scale in order to see if something is successful enough to do on a large scale
examples: a pilot episode (= of a radio or television series)
